item.title: 埃德加-布朗夫曼的派拉蒙计划包括与大型科技公司合作
item.description: 据熟悉小埃德加-布朗夫曼想法的人士透露，他为派拉蒙全球公司制定的计划包括与亚马逊公司或苹果公司这样的科技巨头合作，以改善其流媒体电视业务。【原文：Edgar Bronfman Jr.’s plans for Paramount Global include partnering with a technology stalwart like Amazon.com Inc. or Apple Inc. to improve its streaming-TV business, according to people familiar with his thinking.】

item.title: 加拿大劳工委员会命令铁路员工返回工作岗位
item.description: 加拿大的一个独立仲裁庭已命令该国最大的两条铁路的工人重返工作岗位，并进行有约束力的仲裁，以解决这场导致北美供应链瘫痪的纠纷。【原文：An independent tribunal in Canada has ordered workers at the country’s two largest railways to get back on the job and to engage in binding arbitration to resolve a dispute that has snarled North American supply chains.】

item.title: 欧盟警告：红海油轮焚烧可能造成生态灾难
item.description: 欧盟驻该地区的海军部队周六表示，一艘运载原油的船只在红海遭到袭击后起火，可能导致严重的生态灾难。【原文：A ship carrying crude oil that caught fire after being attacked in the Red Sea could lead to a severe ecological disaster, the European Union’s naval force in the region said Saturday.】

item.title: 巴西圣保罗州野火数量创历史新高
item.description: 圣保罗州是拉丁美洲最大经济体中最富裕的地区，但由于湿度低、热浪袭人，这里的火灾数量创下了历史新高。【原文：The state of Sao Paulo, the wealthiest region of the largest economy in Latin America, is facing a record number of fires due to low humidity and a blistering heat wave.】

item.title: 美联储的首选价格指标将强化降息：生态周报
item.description: 下周的美国通胀数据将加强人们对期待已久的降息即将到来的信心，而消费者支出的读数将表明央行成功地保持了经济扩张的态势。【原文：US inflation figures in the coming week will reinforce that long-awaited interest-rate cuts are coming soon, while a reading on consumer spending is seen indicating that the central bank has been successful at keeping the expansion intact.】

item.title: 美联社称 "伊斯兰国 "宣称对德国死亡事件负责
item.description: 美联社援引一个与该恐怖组织有关联的新闻网站的报道称，"伊斯兰国 "声称对德国发生的刺杀三人的事件负责，"目的是为巴勒斯坦和各地的穆斯林复仇"。【原文：The Islamic State claimed responsibility for the fatal stabbings of three people in Germany “to avenge Muslims in Palestine and everywhere,” the Associated Press reported, citing a news site tied to the terror group.】

item.title: 美联储杰克逊霍尔年会的重要启示
item.description: 堪萨斯城联邦储备银行在怀俄明州杰克逊霍尔举办的年度经济研讨会已接近尾声。【原文：The Federal Reserve Bank of Kansas City’s annual economic symposium in Jackson Hole, Wyoming is winding down.】

item.title: 货币经理人寻求收益，垃圾债券到期墙坍塌
item.description: 事实证明，人们担心的 "到期墙 "更像是一个减速带，今年到目前为止，全球垃圾债券市场的债务偿还率出现了至少十年来的最大降幅。【原文：The feared maturity wall is proving more of a speed bump, with the world’s junk bond market so far this year seeing the biggest decline in looming debt repayments in at least a decade.】

item.title: 巴西央行行长称劳动力市场紧张是一项挑战
item.description: 巴西央行行长罗伯托-坎波斯-内托（Roberto Campos Neto）表示，劳动力市场紧张使抑制通胀的任务面临挑战，因为将价格压力降回目标的进程比预期的要慢。【原文：Brazil central bank Governor Roberto Campos Neto said a tight labor market has made the task of taming inflation a challenge, as the process to lower price pressures back to goal has been slower than anticipated.】

item.title: 加纳主要反对党计划拨款 100 亿美元提振经济
item.description: 加纳的主要反对党表示，如果在 2024 年 12 月的选举中获胜，它将根据一项所谓的 "大推动计划 "投资 100 亿美元，以推动经济增长和提升经济规模。【原文：Ghana’s main opposition party said it will invest $10 billion under a so-called big-push program to drive growth and lift the size of the economy if it wins the December 2024 elections.】

item.title: 埃利奥特牵头竞购委内瑞拉控股的美国炼油企业 Citgo
item.description: 据知情人士透露，埃利奥特投资管理公司（Elliott Investment Management）是美国法院下令拍卖委内瑞拉炼油商 Citgo 石油公司母公司的主要竞标者。【原文：Elliott Investment Management is the leading bidder in a US court-ordered auction of the parent company of Venezuelan-owned refiner Citgo Petroleum Corp., according to people with knowledge of the process.】

item.title: 欧洲央行行长莱恩称重返 2% 通胀目标尚不确定
item.description: 欧洲中央银行首席经济学家菲利普-莱恩（Philip Lane）表示，欧洲中央银行将通胀率恢复到 2% 的战斗尚未取得胜利，为实现这一目标，利率必须维持在必要的高位，同时又不会对经济造成过度损害。【原文：The European Central Bank’s battle to return inflation to 2% isn’t won and interest rates must stay as high as necessary to achieve that goal, without harming the economy unduly, according to Chief Economist Philip Lane.】

item.title: 津巴布韦电力公司警告故障导致停电情况增加
item.description: 津巴布韦国有电力公司称，由于一家燃煤发电厂出现技术故障，该公司加强了电力配给。【原文：Zimbabwe’s state-owned power utility says it implemented increased power rationing due to a technical fault at a coal-fired power plant.】

item.title: 土耳其调查财务总监辞职的虚假社交媒体帖子
item.description: 土耳其资本市场委员会（SPK）周六宣布，土耳其正在调查社交媒体上谎称财政部长穆罕默德-西姆塞克（Mehmet Simsek）已辞职的帖子，这些帖子引发了伊斯坦布尔证券交易所的暴跌。【原文：Turkey is investigating social media posts that falsely claimed Finance Minister Mehmet Simsek had quit, triggering a sharp drop in the Istanbul Stock Exchange, the Capital Markets Board, or SPK, announced on Saturday.】

item.title: 中国不会禁止债券交易，但认为疯狂购买存在风险
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，中国人民银行没有也不会试图禁止合法的国债投资或交易，但它认为疯狂购买国债存在风险。【原文：The People’s Bank of China did not seek to nor will it seek to ban legitimate investments or trading in its government bonds, but it sees risks in a buying spree of the securities, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 欧洲央行霍尔茨曼称 9 月减息并非 "板上钉钉
item.description: 欧洲中央银行理事会成员罗伯特-霍尔兹曼（Robert Holzmann）警告说，尽管他的几位同事发出了降息信号，但下个月不一定会降息。【原文：European Central Bank Governing Council member Robert Holzmann warned that interest rates won’t necessarily be lowered next month — despite several of his colleagues signaling a cut.】

item.title: 争夺关键矿产推动非洲铁路复兴
item.description: 南部非洲的铁路突然受到全球关注，并吸引了数十亿美元的投资，其核心是争夺能源转型所需的铜供应。【原文：Southern Africa’s railways are suddenly getting global attention and attracting billions of dollars in investment, with a race to secure copper supplies needed for the energy transition at its center.】

item.title: 被定罪的新加坡大亨的豪宅折价 300 万美元出售
item.description: 一位被定罪的石油大亨的豪宅以低于原要价近 400 万新元（310 万美元）的价格出售，这表明，尽管新加坡高端市场的销售有所复苏，但估值仍面临压力。【原文：A convicted oil tycoon’s mansion is being sold for nearly S$4 million ($3.1 million) off its original asking price, in a sign of the pressure on valuations in Singapore’s high-end market despite a recovery in sales.】

item.title: 为什么阿姆斯特朗的司法改革令投资者感到恐慌？
item.description: 即将卸任的总统安德烈斯-曼努埃尔-洛佩斯-奥夫拉多尔（Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador）又一次颠覆了墨西哥的政治格局，他正在推动通过一项有争议的改革，这项改革将彻底改变墨西哥的司法体系。【原文：Outgoing President Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador is upending the Mexican political landscape one more time, pushing to pass a controversial reform that would deeply transform the country’s judiciary.】

item.title: 菲律宾将在金三角被捕的 7 名国民遣送回国
item.description: 菲律宾每日问询者报》（Philippine Daily Inquirer）周六援引菲律宾外交部的消息报道，菲律宾已经遣返了七名在老挝与缅甸和泰国边境附近的经济特区被捕的菲律宾国民。【原文：The Philippines has repatriated seven of its nationals who had been arrested at a special economic zone in Laos near its borders with Myanmar and Thailand, the Philippine Daily Inquirer reported Saturday, citing the Department of Foreign Affairs.】

item.title: 马来西亚 5G 网络所有者放弃向马来西亚电信出售股权
item.description: 马来西亚唯一的5G网络所有者Digital Nasional Bhd.表示，它终止了向马来西亚电信公司（Telekom Malaysia Bhd.）出售2.33亿林吉特（5330万美元）股份的提议，因为后者未能满足最终完成交易的必要条件。【原文：Malaysia’s sole 5G network owner Digital Nasional Bhd. said it terminated a proposed 233 million ringgit ($53.3 million) stake sale to Telekom Malaysia Bhd. after the latter failed to meet necessary conditions to finalize the deal.】

item.title: 中国顶级消费者收入显示股市复苏遥遥无期
item.description: 中国最大的消费企业一个接一个地报告收入不佳，打破了市场复苏的预期。【原文：One by one, China’s biggest consumer companies are reporting revenue misses, upsetting expectations for a market recovery to take hold.】

item.title: 英国发布黄色天气预警，预计部分地区降雨量将达 70 毫米
item.description: 周六，英国部分地区可能会出现 50 毫米到 70 毫米的降雨，气象局对英格兰东南部大部分地区发布了黄色天气预警。【原文：Some parts of the UK could see between 50mm and 70mm of rain on Saturday, with the Met Office issuing a yellow weather warning for much of the south east of England.】

item.title: 因涉嫌欺诈被叫停后，Elektra 被 S&P 公司从墨西哥指数中剔除
item.description: 亿万富翁里卡多-萨利纳斯-普利戈（Ricardo Salinas Pliego）控制的埃莱克特拉集团（Grupo Elektra SAB）在股票停牌数周之后，被从墨西哥基准股票指数中除名。【原文：Grupo Elektra SAB, controlled by billionaire Ricardo Salinas Pliego, was removed from Mexico’s benchmark stock index after shares were halted for weeks, a suspension prompted by the company to interrupt an alleged multimillion-dollar fraud.】

item.title: 废除增税政策后，S&P 公司将肯尼亚的减税政策进一步推向深入
item.description: 在肯尼亚政府否决了旨在解决财政失衡问题的有争议的增税措施后，S&P 全球评级公司将肯尼亚的信用评级下调至垃圾级。【原文：S&P Global Ratings downgraded Kenya’s credit score deeper into junk after the government nixed controversial tax hikes meant to address fiscal imbalances.】

item.title: 对冲基金抛售柴油，供应过剩拖累期货市场
item.description: 投资者已转而严重看跌柴油，对柴油价格下跌的押注飙升至 2020 年初开始锁定以来的最高水平。【原文：Investors have turned deeply bearish on diesel, with bets on falling prices surging to the highest level since lock-downs began in early 2020.】

item.title: 对冲基金看涨黄金的赌注创四年新高
item.description: 货币经理们对黄金的看涨押注跃升至四年多来的最高点，原因是他们预期美联储将更早、更深入地实行货币宽松政策以刺激经济。【原文：Money managers’ bullish wagers on gold jumped to the highest in more than four years on expectations for earlier, deeper monetary easing by the Federal Reserve to bolster the economy.】

item.title: 杰罗姆-鲍威尔的支点推动了华尔街的全面反弹
item.description: 杰罗姆-鲍威尔发出了迄今为止最果断的信号，表明他已经完成了对抗通胀的使命，这有助于恢复市场秩序，而就在三周前，市场还陷入了自大流行病以来最严重的动荡之中。【原文：Jerome Powell’s most decisive signal yet that his inflation-fighting mission has been accomplished has helped restore order to markets that only three weeks ago were engulfed in the worst upheaval since the pandemic.】

item.title: 爱尔兰因公共财政和经济增长而上调信用评级
item.description: Scope Ratings 将爱尔兰的信用评级上调了一个等级，原因是该国公共财政状况良好，经济增长强劲。【原文：Scope Ratings upgraded Ireland’s credit rating by one notch, as it pointed to the nation’s strong public finances and robust economic growth.】

item.title: McKesson 正在洽谈佛罗里达癌症专科医院股份事宜
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，麦可森公司（McKesson Corp. ）正在就收购佛罗里达癌症专科研究所（Florida Cancer Specialists & Research Institute）的控股权进行深入谈判，该研究所是一家私营肿瘤诊所运营商。【原文：McKesson Corp. is in advanced talks to buy a controlling stake in Florida Cancer Specialists & Research Institute, a privately-held operator of oncology clinics, according to people familiar with the matter.】
